        public void postConstruct()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBInternal
        A method called by the ChronoDBFactory after initializing this new instance.

        This method serves as a startup hook that can be used e.g. to check if any recovery operations are necessary.

      • close

        public final void close()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDB
        Closes this instance of ChronoDB.

        This completely shuts down the database. Any further calls to retrieve or store data will fail.

        Users are responsible for calling this method when the interaction with the database stops in order to allow ChronoDB to shutdown gracefully.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface ChronoDB

      • isClosed

        public final boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDB
        Checks if this instance of ChronoDB has already been closed or not.

        This method is safe to call even after ChronoDB.close() has been called.

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface ChronoDB
        Returns:
        true if this ChronoDB instance is closed, otherwise false.

      • entryStream

        public CloseableIterator<ChronoDBEntry> entryStream()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBInternal
        Creates an iterable stream of entries that reside in this ChronoDB instance.

        IMPORTANT: The resulting stream must be closed by the caller!

        Recommended usage pattern is with "try-with-resources": 

         try (ChronoDBEntryStream stream = chronoDBInternal.entryStream()) {
        while (stream.hasNext()) {
                ChronoDBEntry entry = stream.next();
                // do something with the entry
        }
 } catch (Exception e) {
        // treat exception
 }
        Specified by:
        entryStream in interface ChronoDBInternal
        Returns:
        The stream of entries. Never null, may be empty. Must be closed explicitly.

      • loadEntries

        public void loadEntries(java.util.List<ChronoDBEntry> entries)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBInternal
        Loads the given list of entries into this ChronoDB instance.

        Please note that it is assumed that the corresponding branches already exist in the system. This method performs no locking on its own!

        Specified by:
        loadEntries in interface ChronoDBInternal
        Parameters:
        entries - The entries to load. Must not be null, may be empty.

      • writeDump

        public void writeDump(java.io.File dumpFile,
                      DumpOption... dumpOptions)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDB
        Creates a database dump of the entire current database state.

        Please note that the database is not available for write operations while the dump process is running. Read operations will work concurrently as usual.

        WARNING: The file created by this process may be very large (several gigabytes), depending on the size of the database. It is the responsibility of the user of this API to ensure that enough disk space is available; this method does not perform any checks regarding disk space availability!

        WARNING: The given file will be overwritten without further notice!

        Specified by:
        writeDump in interface ChronoDB
        Parameters:
        dumpFile - The file to store the dump into. Must not be null. Must point to a file (not a directory). The standard file extension *.chronodump is recommmended, but not required. If the file does not exist, the file (and any missing parent directory) will be created.
        dumpOptions - The options to use for this dump (optional). Please refer to the documentation of the invididual constants for details.

      • readDump

        public void readDump(java.io.File dumpFile,
                     DumpOption... dumpOptions)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDB
        Reads the contents of the given dump file into this database.

        This is a management operation; it completely locks the database. No concurrent writes or reads will be permitted while this operation is being executed.

        WARNING: The current contents of the database will be merged with the contents of the dump! In case of conflicts, the data stored in the dump file will take precedence. It is strongly recommended to perform this operation only on an empty database!

        WARNING: As this is a management operation, there is no rollback or undo option!

        Specified by:
        readDump in interface ChronoDB
        Parameters:
        dumpFile - The dump file to read the data from. Must not be null, must exist, and must point to a file (not a directory).
        dumpOptions - The options to use while reading (optional). May be empty.

      • lockExclusive

        public Lockable.LockHolder lockExclusive()
        Description copied from interface: Lockable
        Declares that a thread is about to perform an exclusive task that can not run in parallel with other tasks.

        All invocations of this method must adhere to the following usage pattern: 

         try (LockHolder lock = db.lockExclusive()) {
        // ... perform tasks ...
 }
        This method ensures that exclusive operations are properly blocked when another operation is taking place.
        Specified by:
        lockExclusive in interface Lockable
        Returns:
        The object representing lock ownership. The lock ownership will be released once Lockable.LockHolder.close() is invoked, which is called automatically by the try-with-resources statement.

      • lockNonExclusive

        public Lockable.LockHolder lockNonExclusive()
        Description copied from interface: Lockable
        Declares that a thread is about to perform a non-exclusive task that can run in parallel with other non-exclusive locking tasks.

        All invocations of this method must adhere to the following usage pattern: 

         try (LockHolder lock = db.lockNonExclusive()) {
        // ... perform tasks ...
 }
        This method ensures that non-exclusive operations are properly blocked when an exclusive operation is taking place.
        Specified by:
        lockNonExclusive in interface Lockable
        Returns:
        The object representing lock ownership. The lock ownership will be released once Lockable.LockHolder.close() is invoked, which is called automatically by the try-with-resources statement.

        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface ChronoDB
        Returns:
        The configuration. Never null.

      • getTKVS

        protected TemporalKeyValueStore getTKVS(java.lang.String branchName)

      • updateBuildVersionInDatabase

        protected abstract void updateBuildVersionInDatabase()
        Updates the Chronos Build Version in the database.

        Implementations of this method should follow this algorithm:

        1. Check if the version identifier in the database exists.
          1. If there is no version identifier, write ChronosVersion.getCurrentVersion().
          2. If there is a version identifier, and it is smaller than ChronosVersion.getCurrentVersion(), overwrite it (Note: in the future, we may perform data migration steps here).
          3. If there is a version identifier larger than ChronosVersion.getCurrentVersion(), throw a ChronosBuildVersionConflictException.
